intro: Conanthus depressus, commonly known as the low conanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to violet. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and heat. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Conanthus depressus is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes, where it thrives in full sun.
